text: Very nice clean place! Very friendly staff! Excellent food and hunts brothers pizza! Gas is only about 10¢ higher than the main roads, but not bad for out of way location!

text: Great place to stop on the way to the river..

name: Luke Krause
text: There is a meat and three inside. They also do short orders for things like burger's and chicken.

name: Bob Frick
text:
Totally SHOCKED !!
Took my tanks in to have refilled, which where filled two months earlier else where. Get to the back to fill the worker comes out we talk, then I’m told my tank is too old to fill, oh ok now he is checking the other tank. It’s is out of date too . Well of course I inquire about how to tell. Then he tells me how you can be harmed horribly by filling an out of date tank. Says I should be a new tank come with me I’ll show you some. Then tells me how the state test them by getting them to fill bad tanks and more Regulation talk. THEN HE SAYS I WOULD FILL THE TANKS IF I KNEW YOU .
WHAT I ASKED DID YOU SAY ? Did you say if you knew me you would fill them? He said yes.
WHAT IN THE WORLD IS GOING ON HERE?? I left THAT IS VERY DANGEROUS!!!! NEVER AGAIN WILL I USE THIS PLACE. TOTALLY UNSAFE SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN!!!
Fill out of date tanks if they know you.REALLY.

name: Rick Thompson
text:
1 star for being a bunch of time wasters. We were loyal customers for 3 years. We moved houses and asked for them to come out and fill our tank in the new house.

Monday-- Dispatch said they will put us in the system and will be onsite next day.
Tuesday-- No show. Called dispatch and they assured us we where in the "system" and will be out next day.
Wednesday -- No show. Called again and told us we were not in the "system". Scheduled us for next day.
Thursday -- No show. They told us once more that they will come tomorrow. After hearing that a 4th time we decided to cancel.

@ThompsonGas Whatever "system" you are using will undoubtedly lose more customers.  Be honest when building expectations. It would have been totally fine if you said "we'll be there on Friday." But instead I was told "tomorrow" each time. So I stayed home when I could have been in the office. Get your shjt together, be professionals,  and stop leading people on.

name: Ailee Hood
text: Very helpful customer service i.e. how to get an account and service set up, and yes they take care of you way out in the country!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing!

name: Barbara Evans
text: Good service. Caring people.

name: Sharon DeFee
text: Office personnel are so lacking they can't find your bill by name or address. Maybe I'll just change to ACME.

name: Melissa Hearon
text: I want to start off by saying I usually love Holston Gases I buy all my welding supply and propane from them. For the most part they have a very good staff.  I was very disappointed with them this morning when I called at 7 a.m. to get some propane delivery before the storm. I was told they was closed because the weather coming in and my name would be added to a list for delivery when they reopen.

name: Nora Anderson
text: We had one of the worst experiences ever with a propane company.  The guy at the desk did not want to fill our tank on on motorhome, when he said he would I understand why he did not want to do it he had no ideal how to fill a tank.  He freaked out and told us there was something wrong, well that is the overfill valve, he didn't know what that was!!  Then he wanted to charge us 2X's what we were quoted, lucky for us the person who stated our original price was there and he had to charge us what was quoted.  I suggest do not let that man ever fill anything!!   Will never go to them again.

name: Thomas Ostrander
text:
In addition to the various industrial gasses they supply. They also have a very nice selection of welding supplies. Everything from flints, to coats, to multi-thousand dollar welders.
As a welding student at Calhoun Community College I really appreciate that the staff know exactly what you're looking for, even if you don't, and will have it for you in seconds. They also have never tried to upsell me on anything or batted an eyelash at me walking in and only buying a $16 pair of gloves.

name: Jim Macaulay
text: Staff is always helpful one of the best places to get welding supplies

resp.text: Thank you Jim! We are always happy to help!

name: Todd Bohn
text: Very well run organization. Also, if you are a welding student,  you get a discount.  Check with them on this for the details.

name: Stuart
text: Very helpful and knowledgeable staff, I always come here to get all my food grade co2 beverage and gas needs.

text:
I am having issues getting my mail delivered and on my way to work I tried to go through the drive-through which I’ve done many times before without my bill.  After waiting for the car in front of me to finish I was told they were busy and they were only helping people at the drive-through who have their bill and I had to go inside which I did not have time to do.

It was a day later and I called  to ask how much my bill was so I could drop it in the box after hours and I was literally yelled at by the same lady over the phone. This is ridiculous and by far the rudest and worst customer service I’ve ever had in my life. cheer up you old grouch!

name: Jake Warren
text:
2018 and still can't pay online. If you aren't home they will leave the disconnect notice on your door. If you are home they will leave the disconnect somewhere else and not even alert you that they are cutting off your gas. If you catch them in the act of cutting it off, you can't simply call and make a payment to keep it on. You have to go up there in person, then the same guy that cut it off will come back out 30 minutes later to turn it back on. Pretty pathetic customer service all around.

I have a feeling that the 5 star reviews on google are all employees, because if you look anywhere else for reviews(facebook, yellowpages, businessfinder) they all say the same thing... horrible customer service with outdated methods.

My Gas was cut off and temperatures were scheduled to be in the 30's. All they would say "it's policy"! This was absolutely ridiculous. Why does it matter who pays the bill as long as it gets paid! They could care less! Let them sit in a freezing house and see how long they would last under their "policy". We are new to Arab and this kind of treatment is heartless!

text: We come here a lot. But now, I am done. It's happened a couple other times, but never this bad. It's Sunday afternoon. There are two ladies already at the chicken counter. Waiting. I come up and the girl cooking completely ignores us.i can see her in the back. Cooking. The girl working the register yells at the deli lady. She screams back, yes, screams,that she is dropping chicken, that she can't sell it if it's not cooked. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL. I work in retail. You do NOT do that to customers. All she had to do was let us know, and that would have been it . Just say, " I am dropping chicken. I will be there as soon as I can "  But, no. She has to scream. So...

Will not be returning anymore.. check before you pay!!

Ok I looked past a lot of issues, so now it is time to unload... I heard from one of the employees that they are paid less than minimum wage. Then today, I get gas, and wanted a diet root beer. They refused to accept my debit card payment, because the root beer was under $3..... And I just got $30 in gas.

I live out here. You seriously lost a local customer who has a 30 year mortgage, over $3. Good Job!!!

text: Rude, unwelcoming customer service. I have been a regular customer in their store, but not any longer. You can tell that they were hit hard by the pandemic. Got tired of things being ridiculously overpriced and messy in their store all the time. Now it is happening more than ever. They also stopped carrying Golden Flake and Utz chips recently so that is another reason to avoid their store from faaaar away.

name: matthew spaeth
text: I live very close to this gas station and used to use it on a regular basis, that is until I noticed all the security tags were torn/cut. I have had 2 incidents of fraud on my account relating to this gas station, both for around $100 dollars, so unless you like your credit card information to be skimmed, and money taken from your account, do not stop in at this gas station, it is a scam waiting on you to pull up and swipe.

He owns 3 -4 stores and have seen him running two registers at once on numerous times. He also does not pay time in a half to host employees. 2016 law was passed that everyone making vfc under 46000 has to be paid time and a half after forty. Regardless.

name: Clayton Coram
text: I just went here to get a drink during my work shift and while I was in there a gentleman in one of the isles passed out. It turns out he was diabetic and his blood sugar dropped and he was hardly able to stand. The workers promptly got him into a chair while we called an ambulance to come check him out. Rita, one of the cashiers, stayed with him and got him a snickers and a coke to help bring his blood sugar back up. All the while making sure she did everything within her power to help him. Anyone with that kind of compassion for strangers deserves a 5 star review for not only the establishment they work for, but for her as a person.

name: Lee Lee
text: I’ve been passing this little smoke fest store. The pink pig on the corner is a landmark for coming home late, or going early. Needed gas. Went inside & the friendliest lady. Other honestly scrounge lookers came in & she knew them. It was the sweetest feeling. Ribs w/dry rub once home were wonderful. Not greasy, & not falling off the bone!

The sauce was probably purchased from Dollar General across the street along with the stale and stiff buns. I could only stomach barely half the sandwich I spent 5 bucks on and I am hoping I dont get sick. The service was ok so nothing bad to say there but the food is questionable at best.

UNBELIEVABLY RUDE!!! It's not the friendliest of locations but for crying out loud REALLY? If only I could leave zero stars.

Now I’m trying to get in contact with all gas on Monday and can’t get anything but an automated service call that hangs up and won’t give me the option of speaking with a contact center representative! Google says every branch is open so why can’t I talk to someone about my services requested that should’ve already been delivered and setup but haven’t!!!!

name: Leslie Pelham
text: I stay close by so I shop at Chevron all the time. They have a bunch of great, friendly, down home women who work there. Melissa is a great girl. They all are. Store is always stocked and clean. They sell bait that is always fresh. No stinky smells there. They remember your name and treat you well. For a 24 hour store it don't get much better. I give these ladies 5 stars. My highest compliment on a job well done. Keep that coffee going for me.

name: Daniel Deyette
text: It's open, it has stuff, and the people are reasonably polite. So, it gets two stars. The staff is slow moving, and the price of a thermos refill of coffee is both unadvertised and absurd; something like $5 for a thermos of coffee! I rarely pay over $1.50 (never more than $2) and I travel all over the country. They told me after I had filled my thermos. I balked and was ready to just dump it when they decided to just give it to me for free. So, they must know their pricing is off and their policy is not exactly forthcoming. I won't come here again unless I'm strapped for something.

name: Nicholas Nicholas
text: Great staff at this location. Always friendly.

name: Reginald jamar
text: Too many people hanging around a gas station can't be good.

name: Lizette Martinez
text: Really rude and impatient all the time I was really nice and they would answer me with what or ok bye. Do not recommend

name: Chris Mahan
text: This is a great propane company with dedicated employees.

name: Brian Simpson
text: Southland has supplied our farm on Straight Mountain the last 3 years - we're moving now and very sad that we'll have to find a new propane company.  They're as hardworking and honest as they come and we became great friends with our drivers over the years.  Always very fast to deliver and friendly!

name: michael black
text: Not just a good place to get gas.  Greg and his folks do all they can to make your job painless and stress free.  They helped us out after a fallen tree rolled our tank.  Initially reset the tank but then recommended we replace it.  Brought and set up a new one.  Each time we called and told them what we needed they had it done no later than the next day!  I'm sure scheduling wouldn't always allow that but I bet that's still what they would try!

name: Sacred
text: Rudest place you will ever visit. If not for the Cents Off program I would never visit here. The most recent experience was that I stopped at 10:01 for fuel. Two cars were in the lot along with one at the pumps. Entire place was lit up and signs were on. I get out and begin to swipe my card and this heavy set woman runs out of the store telling sir sir we are closed. You’d never know they were closed by the lights and pumps being on. She told me she promised the fuel will still be there in the morning. I took my business across the street. What kind of idiot refuses business? I should have swiped my card and continued.

text: Bathrooms clean

text: We live right across from this store and go there about 2 or 3 times a week. They are always friendly, clean and well stocked.  The pumps are always clean and the trash emptied. They are always busy but do a great job of keeping the place up.

name: Chad Ellis
text: This place had a friendly staff. Always pleasant service, good quality product. Locally owned businesses men. I'm proud to keep my money within the community.

name: Harold Burkett
text: Been coming here for years

name: James Edington
text: The gas pump wouldn't stop blasting ads at me, none of the buttons would mute it, and it canceled my attempt at fueling without warning me because I pressed the wrong button, then it asked me questions about a carwash before it would yield a receipt

name: Chloe A P
text: They need to adjust their car wash!!!!!  The water pressure almost ripped the paint off my car for real

name: Stan Reese
text: Clean and efficient and mostly friendly.

name: Alexis Cook
text: Service is good. Food is ok, depending on who is cooking.

name: Monty Mann
text: Before I could get out of my car there was someone to help get my propane tank filled.  AWESOME service and simply not expected .  Helpful people in the beautiful showroom, too.  Very highly recommended!

name: Michael Miller
text: 5 Star Service. I am a new customer at Gala Gas and this was the first and last company I will deal with. Everyone from the office, to the installers, to Keith the delivery driver was absolutely friendly, courteous, professional, and happy to answer all my questions and explained the equipment and process to me. Prices for the equipment, rental, and for the propane from my investigation are the cheapest in the wiregrass area. I will definitely recommend Gala Gas to anyone who's looking for a gas company to do business with and for my future projects. Thanks to everyone at Gala Gas Company. Looking forward to many years ofdoing business with you.

name: Dot Parsons
text: This business is wonderful! We've been buying gas here exclusively for a few years. On a late Saturday night we figured out we were out of gas. NO HOT WATER!!  I called early Sunday morning and after church Keith showed up and got us taken care of. He's always friendly and knowledgeable.  We are permanent customers of GALA GAS CO. THANK YOU so much for being a dependable customer orientated business.😊

name: Absolute Termite and Pest Control
text: Great place to get propane. Fast and cheap!!!

name: Rebecca Neville
text: these are just some of the sweetest and most helpful people i’ve meet! very informative!

name: Tracy Caswell
text: Very friendly and helpful.😀

name: Wendy Kaye Dial
text: Friendly service with a smile.

name: Pat Ferguson
text: Very cold beer 🍺

name: Nikki Dole
text: Very nice ladies, clean restrooms and the food was amazing.  Definitely added this truck stop to our route.

name: Jason Shoumaker
text: I stopped to get a great breakfast for me and my brother as we run teams, 1 of only 2 truck stops that had become a must to stop when traveling on I-22 but after this am it will become a place that we will not stop at for anything there's only 2 toilets in men's restroom one was occupied and the other was absolutely disgusting, it had feces all over toilet seat, told cashier about it and asked to use a shower for restroom and was told nope thats what the restrooms are for.

name: Sergio Leyva
text: Big parking lot. Friendly staff. Truck diesel. Not much food but huddle house next door

name: Robert Martin
text: The people are friendly, the food from the cafe inside was delicious, only down fall is the mens room, it was nasty, only 1 stall was working and a line of people waiting to use it.

name: Tony
text: Great place for finding parking. Huge lot with a small paved section with the rest being gravel. Virtually no holes in the gravel which was great. Inside was alright and the bathrooms could use some attention.

name: MusicMovesMe78
text:
4/21/21 - still set this lovely place on my route for this good home cooking. Tonight for dinner: fried fish fillets, turnip greens, mashed potatoes, regular cornbread, and a piece of birthday sprinkle vanilla cake with lemon frosting for dessert. Finish it off with a cup of sweet tea. ❤ (Obviously I like their fried fish fillets.)

Also, they have since remodeled the restrooms and have added showers for $10.00 each. Dont listen to the folks who are fussin' in the comment section here. Come on in and try out Cafe 30, great truck parking (if you get in at a decent time) and friendly folks inside. 👍🏻👍🏻

2019:  Who needs Huddle House next door when you have a diner like this in the truck stop? Super good food and friendly customer service. Not hating on Huddle House. They're great, too ... but this? This is that food right here.

name: Linda Danahy
text:
Just your average convenient store.
However, the food in the deli is so delicious.
Freshly made with homemade taste.
Worth the stop.
Big rig truck parking.
Saving this place on my GPS.

name: Phillip Vineyard
text: Really good food. They serve breakfast and the pancakes are as big as a to go box hot and delicious. The lady that was working the morning of 4-8-2020 was really nice (and pretty) worth stopping for, big parking lot the back is a little rough bc its gravel front lot is paved. ENJOY !!!!!

name: shelby phillips
text: Country fried steak was delicious... Cashier was super friendly... Don't let the outside appearance fool you... It's worth the stop!

name: arc gaming
text: Women’s bathroom had several holes in the wall and a large hole in the ceiling. Felt kinda creepy, but we had been on the toad awhile, so whatever. My husband paid for our gas but then My daughter wanted a snack...A pack of gum and a bag cheese it’s. Was around $3. Lady at the register told me that they don’t allow purchases under $5 on a card...only cash. So I told her to keep it. Cashier even made the comment that they get a lot of angry customers because of it. I can see why. Went across the street to the Shell station. Much cleaner, the same items were about a dollar cheeped and they didn’t mind to do business transactions under $5 dollars. Wish we had given them out gas business too. Will remember that next time.

name: Jourdan Lowery
text: Looks better cashier are friendlier since the new management took over last week great food at the cafe 30 the manager already got new locks on the stall doors and they sell phone cards again they even have a small dog park now where travelers can walk their dogs

name: Truckin Games
text: Review just for the parking. Usually can find spots most of the time.

name: Truth and Justice
text: Great home cooked food for a great price! Meat and two sides with a drink and bread of your choice only $8! Nice little place to sit down and eat with a tv! Tons of parking in the gravel lot out back! Good experience here every time!

name: Max Cady
text: My wife and I usually stop in this place once or twice a year when driving from Memphis to Atlanta, religiously we purchase a new US road atlas map in this store. We noticed they stopped carrying road maps and atlases, plus they got rid of all sorts of stuff. So we drove down to Loves truck stop and got a new atlas map there. We will now go to Loves from now on. It’s around exit 50

name: Loren Collins
text: Clutch place to park . Lots of truck parking. Huge lot. Nice food. Was low on hours needed a place to stop. Good phone signal 👍

name: Cynthia Keene
text: Cafe 30 in the Chevron station has the best homemade food. The roast beef w/potatoes & carrots, purple hull beans, cabbage and cornbread was very tasty.

name: Joseph Bennett
text: Get a filling meal for under 10 dollars. Plenty of paved and unpaved big rig parking. Sassy workers that make you smile and a place to sit, that isn't that truck. Overall a decent experience. They do have a huddle House next door, if you are to uppity to eat good southern cooking.

name: Tammy Harbin
text: Awesome homemade hamburgers , employees are nice good parking and fuel prices are great bathrooms need a little over haul but great place

name: Norbert D Dounseroux
text: I chose to stop here seeing I hadn't been here in a couple years. I have no problem supporting the little stops and was surprised to see they finally saved enough money to asphalt some of the truck parking. I guess the stripes will come way later. My offense was the men's room, smells, no locks on the stalls, and trash on the floor. You have a long way to go!

name: Karl Wolf
text:
Nice place for a driver to stop and get a bite to eat. Food is reasonable and served with a smile.
Plenty of truck parking as long as you park properly.
Not sure about all the bad reviews regarding the restrooms, its not a 5 star hotel and was adequate for my needs.
Will stop here again.

name: BOGUS Blank
text: Women behind counter said nothing at all.when I go to a normal place of business I am usually greeted with hello may I help you.not here made me feel like I did something wrong or maybe my long hair out of place for the southern folks.when I did get my food of which I ordered to go I had to ask for a bag.oh bathroom stalls are falling apart and no paper towels in bathroom how is a trucker going to wash their face and dry it?oh I know stick your head in the blow dryer! Other than all that it's a place to park and go to the restroom as long as you don't expect any privacy when you sit on the toilet.

name: Ana Shomaker
text:
This place was disgusting, the guy who runs it is trash too. I told him the restrooms were beyond filthy and he told me that it was only him there and that he has 1 person come clean it at night, I told him they could do a better job because it doesn’t look like anything has been wiped down swept or mopped or weeks.
It’s prolly got parasites all over the place.

It’s even more disappointing that when I told the man he didn’t even apologize he just argued with me about it.
Also across the board the gas has been anywhere from 2.30 to 2.50 and his gas was way over priced at 2.75.
Pretty sure he was selling cigarettes to underage kids as well.

name: GaryMac
text: Great food at great prices. Them girls in there can cook. A lot of truck parking. And if you don't like home cooking there is a Huddle House next door. I stop here all the time. Good place.

name: Sean Kerno

One toilet seat wasn't even on the toilet and the other toilet was stuffed with toilet paper to the point where I was scared to flush it to try to use the bathroom. I don't understand how so many women work here and that bathroom is not decent, you have to use that bathroom all day! Living in a truck these bathrooms are my only options and I've never been so pissed, sad sad excuse for a truck stop! If you have a wife or you are a woman truck driver do yourself a favor and pass this exit, for your own health. I'm very upset about having to stop here for the night.

name: Mike Mason
text:
Hands down, the absolute BEST Bar-B-q not only in town but in St. Clair county. They are proud of it but it's not reflected in their prices.
Teeth are not required for any of their quality, well prepared meats. Rib meat literally falls off the bone. So tender you can almost eat the bones themselves. You choose the sauce you prefer and their menu is large. They offer family meals as well as party size orders. There is decent barbq nearby in town but none of it even comes close to this store's fine Q.
Today i was served a HUGE T-bone steak with potato and side salad for $11.99.
Your simply not gonna beat that.
And if your in the mood for a simple bbq sammich then they have a sammich, bag-o-chips and 20 oz. drink deal. Trust me when I tell you. It's worth it. Stay away from "gas station sushi" but this bbq is worth a 50 mile drive and thats the honest truth.
Enjoy.

name: Autonomous Johnson
text:
Absolute worst vendor of propane in Madison County. Terrible to do business with. Go with anyone else.

To add to my review. I was not a customer with Central Propane. I bought my home and the previous owner rented a tank from Central. However, I was never informed of this and was told by my real estate agent that we owned the tank. There were no markings on the tank.

One day I came home and my propane tank was gone. It turned out that Central propane owned the tank. However, instead of sending a bill for the rent of the tank to my address, or contacting me by mail about the late rent, they just repossessed the tank.

So now I am without heat. I called Central to understand what happened and the lady at the Hazel Green office was extremely rude. She told me that she had no obligation to contact me about the tank and she didn’t have to explain anything to me because I wasn’t their customer.

I also had been filling the tank under the assumption that I owned it. So, when Central took the tank, I had about $300 of propane in it that I purchased. Central refused to reimburse me for the propane that they stole, even though it was worth more than their late rent. They were extremely rude the whole time. I can’t imagine how anyone deals with them on a regular basis.

I now rent from and buy my propane from Heritage. I’ve never had a problem.

resp.text: Dear Mr Bailey, We are sorry you feel this way. However after looking into our customer database we find that you are not and have never been a customer of Central Propane.

name: Gwyn Wright
text: These folks are great to work with. Kelly is always kind and nice.

name: Bryan Neece
text: If you have to have your tank filled up on an “off Route day” be ready to drop $200 in their pocket on top of the price of the propane, which was $3.09 a gallon in January. I realize the local folks with the company may not set these prices and extra ridiculous fees but this company ripped me off last Saturday.

resp.text:
Dear Bryan,

Routing deliveries helps Central Propane provide our customers with the best price and service possible. Overall it helps us keep operating costs down. Our normal business hours and days of delivery are Monday – Friday, 8 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Delivering to customers on a scheduled timeline provides more reliable, cost-efficient service that is not possible with off-route deliveries. We understand your concerns with the Off-Route fee as we hope you understand that running delivery trucks and staff overtime is not inexpensive. We value you as a customer and want to work together to keep this situation from happening again in the future. Please be sure to call us when your tank’s gauge reads no less than 30%. That will give us time to include you in the next routed delivery for your area, providing you with the best value and service available.

Sincerely, Central Propane

text:
Update: I received a called from Ken W. informing me that they missed the boat on this service and would like to rectify the situation if possible.  I am moving on to another provider but I do appreciate the follow-up and attempt to make things right.

Horrible service: I schedule a simple site survey to have new service installed. They made me wait 14 days. When the 14 days arrived nobody came and nobody called. I called them and they said, "yes it looks like you are on our schedule for today, let me call the technician to see what's up, and then he will call you right back." At 4PM the technician calls me and asks "Hey, you want to talk about propane with me or something?". I said what? you were supposed to be here between noon and 2 and you don't know why you are even calling me. he said "Nobody never tole me nuttin about an appointment, you want to talk on the phone or sumpin?"
Seriously, stay away from people like this.

name: Freida Allen
text:
I am a pre-buy costumer and an automatic-fill and have been with this company for years. But, if my tank were not full, I would be gone! I am on a fixed income so I conserve my gas. Even in this cold winter I conserved to make sure I didn't have to purchase more gas other than my pre-buy. I made it through this rough winter just to have them wait until the end of April to bring what was left of my pre-buy and finish filling the tank with $4.00 gas. They filled my tank in Jan then waited until the end of April and of course my tank was pretty much empty and now I have a tank that will sit full of $4.00 gas for the summer.
I do NOT recommend this company!!!
For the summer my gas tank will be full but my stomach will be empty:(
I changed my review from one star to three only because my price was changed back to what was on contract with my pre-buy. That is close to US average propane prices which were $2.43 last month and down from the month before. No data for this month yet but most likely down alittle more since the season is over.
I do appreciate suburban's attention to my account but I wonder what happened to other customers who are too busy to inspect their invoices.

text: Sleezy business practice.   Watch the pump - they advertise a cheaper price on the sign than what is at the pump.  Sign said $2.39, started pumping and the pump  read $2.43.   At the end of the day $.56 does not break the bank but multiply that times the volume through the station - they are making a ton off false advertising on their street sign.   Brought it to their attention they would not refund $.56 on principle even with my receipt.   Shady practice - check the pump before you pump.

He then proceeded to tell me how much he hated people like me because he had a wife of the same nationsl origin. He kept on insulting me with racist remarks as i left the store, scared and shocked  it is a shame that highly respected brands like chevron could allow a racist of this caliber to denigrate unsuspecting customers with impunity. text: If I could give her 0/5 I would,.. went in there to get my kids some food to snack on,... Bought it, went to give my kids said snacks and seen that the food was out of date. A YEAR OUT OF DATE. The following week, my wife goes in and hesitates before buying anything for our kids again without looking g at the dates,.. turns out it wasn't just the candy I had bought for my kids but all the snack on that shelf and on the opposite one as well,.. so long story short, wife then asks the owner why everything was a YEAR or longer out of date, the lady who owns he Texaco started hollering at my wife and denying everything until my wife the starts taking things off her shelf and showing the old dates in front of her. She then Bans my wife from her store. So yeah she gets a 0/5.

text: It is a Texaco

name: Nathan Westby
text: Amazing hospitality! Allen Herod and his crew are friendly, honest and helpful in a crunch. Much appreciated them getting my vehicle up and running super quickly.

name: Michelle Wallace
text: Excellent service and fast! They look over your vehicle really well letting you know if you need anything else that needs to be done or potentially. Decent prices for there labor and services also.

name: Michael Donahue
text: The best place to get my car worked on, they won’t steer you wrong.

name: patsi ringsdorf
text:
Wonderful family business...honest,which is rare these days,especially for elderly ladies who r often taken advantage of. I dont even usually look at my receipt as they r totally trustworty.
Also,they will work with u for whatever it takes to get the job done. I drive up with a turn signal light out,they r so busy,but boom! Im there about 15 minutes. Recently,had a low tire,again,they r busy,but boom! Get my car serviced and tire fixed,there about 30 or 40 minutes. And some would have sold me a new tire,they told me it was fine,,just needed air. Lots of aggravation in todays world,but not at herrods service station.

name: Ashley Wade
text: I needed two tires patched. After going to two other places and being told I’d have to wait hours, I was told about this location. I came right in and they took care of me immediately! I was probably there a total of 15 mins!! They were very nice and speedy! And oh yeah, only $30 to patch 2 tires!! I highly recommend them!!

name: Andrew Stanley
text: Great place!!! Had my a/c worked on at a fair price & great service. Had my truck back the same day.

name: Charles Myers
text: Great place for auto service needs. I just moved to the area from Virginia and Herrod's was recommended by a friend. They did some work on my pickup and I was highly pleased with the work and fair price. I will continue to use them for all my automotive needs. Allen and Gordon are the best!

name: Carlos Lemus
text: Excellent service. A place where you are a costumer and not a number.

name: Mary Milam
text: Fast service. Good folks.

name: Todd Rogers
text: I have been using them for all my auto needs for over thirty years. First class.

name: Missy Powell
text: My husband and I came in to get a turn signal bulb changed and they were great!! Nice folks 👍

name: clan
text: Always great service and great prices as well!

name: Becca Scott
text: I never even knew that full service gas stations existed anymore, yet Herrod's does! They are SO nice! I arrived with a messed up tire and a restless 6 year old in an extreme hurry to get back to Montgomery, and they not only fixed that tire in about 5 minutes flat with no wait time, but balanced and rotated ALL my tires in about 10 minutes more! They were gentlemen who treated me with respect and didn't rip me off just because I was a woman either. They were VERY reasonable in their prices! I can't speak highly enough about them!
